Code of Conduct
================

Our organization `samcogan-demo` is committed to providing a welcoming, inclusive,
and respectful experience for everyone who participates in our projects.

Expected Behavior
- Be considerate and respectful in communications and reviews.
- Use welcoming language and assume good intent.
- Give and accept constructive feedback gracefully.

Unacceptable Behavior
- Harassment, hate speech, violent language, or discriminatory remarks.
- Targeted insults, sustained harassment, or doxxing.
- Publishing private information without consent.

Enforcement
- If someone violates this Code of Conduct, maintainers may take any action they
  deem appropriate, from asking the person to stop, to temporary or permanent
  removal from the project.

Reporting
- To report an incident, please open a confidential issue addressed to the
  maintainers or email the organization administrator at `opensource@example.com`.
  Provide as much detail as possible (project, time, participants, and any
  relevant links or screenshots).

Scope
- This Code of Conduct applies to all project spaces (issues, pull requests,
  mailing lists, chat channels, community events) and to behavior outside
  these spaces when it affects the community.

Acknowledgements
- This document is adapted for demo purposes from common community standards.
